elkfed.coref.mentions.Mention

  • Packages that use Mention 
    Package Description
    elkfed.coref.algorithms.sieve  
    elkfed.coref.discourse_entities  
    elkfed.coref.mentions
    Provides classes modeling mentions in text to be clustered as corefent.

      Returns a list of Mentions that are morphologically compatible to the Mention and fulfill the binding constraints
      (package private) boolean Sieve.isAnimate(Mention mention)
      Checks if mention is animate Animacy is set using: (a) a static list for pronouns; (b) NER and Gender labels (e.g., PERSON and MALE are animate); and (c) lists of animate and inanimate unigrams taken from https://github.com/castiron/didh/tree/master/lib/vendor/snlp/dcoref; German lists have been translated using Google Translate.
      (package private) boolean Sieve.isNeutral(Mention mention)
      Checks if mention is neutral.
      boolean Sieve.isSpeakerSpeechLeft(Mention mention)
      true if: this method tries to recognize all speakers that have speech to their left, e.g.: "
      boolean Sieve.isSpeakerSpeechRight(Mention mention)
      true if: this method tries to recognize all speakers that have speech to their right, e.g.: A: "..."
      void Evaluation.printMention(Mention m, boolean isAntecedent)
      Prints and writes to a file different features of a mention, such as its string, id, head lemma, head string, discourse entity, set id and discourse entity id for evaluation purposes.
